page.title: 11 Wrinstone Past and Present
page.content: Wrinstone lies in the NE part of Wenvoe Parish, some 6.5km SW of Cardiff. The central feature in the Wrinstone area is Wrinstone Farm and the adjoining cottage. The farm occupies 200 acres of land, comprising 40 acres of corn/hay, 2 acres of potatoes, grazing for 100 ewes and 80 cattle. The present family has held the land for 45 years, but the actual farmhouse dates back to the Medieval Period. This can be confirmed by structural evidence revealed by repairs to the south wall of the house some years ago. The wall was found to be 5ft. thick with a window having a pointed head at first floor level. Wrinstone Farm and the adjoining cottage are actually built on the site of the old castle.
